list_definition.mean_english: người phục vụ, chiêu đãi viên
list_definition.definition: a passenger’s attendant on ship or aeroplane
a person who helps to arrange, and is an official at, races, entertainments etc
a person who supervises the supply of food and stores in a club, on a ship etc.
a person who manages an estate or farm for another person.

list_ex_of_english: Another very important question, to which reference has not been made this evening, is the training of shop stewards.
She said that almost nothing could be done in her hospital without the shop stewards' approval.
We have, therefore, inserted the limitation, first of all, that the number of stewards must be reasonable.
Without a well-financed farming industry, farmers' ability to be the stewards of our countryside—to look after our landscape and environment—is much diminished.
The management said that it was not prepared to meet the shop stewards to discuss a productivity agreement.
I do not think there is any question of having special stewards.
I have received strong representations, not only from shop stewards in factories, but from people working in universities.
The organisers, stewards, the police and everybody else intended that the march should be in two halves.
